alert.note: Alert for Burnett (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 2:18PM CDT until April 16 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Minnesota... St. Croix River AT Danbury affecting Pine and Burnett Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...St. Croix River AT Danbury. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Water begins to spread into picnic grounds near the gage near Highway 35. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 PM CDT Thursday was 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.7 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.5 feet on 06/06/1944. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun St. Croix River Danbury 7.0 7.0 Thu 1 pm CDT 7.7 7.5 7.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 230 AM CDT.
